reviewText:
I have a HIGH standard when it comes to these games, so Here  go.

In my first play I enjoyed  having to fiddle around with my settings, because my computer thinks that Intel I7 must do everything on here (That is why I got Nvidia, Do not tell her that. This poor laptop will die.) But after about an hour so so of check the forms, I found my fix, and check a couple of other things, set it to max and we are golden.

Well when it come to FF many people think story, characters, gameplay, and Narritve.

But as a long time fan of FF 1, 2, & 3 (Yes those golden boys and girls.) I have had a rather gruel expirence coming up todate on this fish. But After begin drianed by all numbers after 4, I had High hopes for this game. Which are listed as such:

Graphcs are good for a PSP game on a PC

The combat mechanic is Intresting, althouhg I do miss Turn based combat. (Old School Kids.)

The cut scences are nice, but I feel they were nto as good as possible (Reminder I am on a laptop.) So I lose my right to complain by limitations.

The characters depth is very, abrupt. (I feel like am at the petting Zoo.) Their desgins are nice, I like the personalities and everything else so far.

Now for my knit picky butt to start its unconrolled rant.

Its a console remake on to a surpior system, of course there are going be issues so stop complaining.

It was all ready made, just not for Pc. Look We al know that most gaming folk's towers can easily eat thos console's newest game for a snack at still chomp down on these kind of games, but Do be so hung up on this game its been played before its ust for those who want it on their PC.

Not much else for a Pre-order, I feel betrayed by some one, or am Paranoid. Honestly I do not DOTA, and am very picky about my games. As much of a Weeaboo, Otaaku gamer thin I am, I feel like this game has a beutiful side that will get ♥♥♥♥ on later.

Since it is a remake there are going to be bugs, and its going to be a little buggy.

So for The final Verdict, Its great, I do like it, I have never cared for many FF games, Because honestly, Cloud has mental bnreakdowns like he is a hipster, Dream squences are over rated, and happy go lucky charcaters do not become shephroth, and Lighting is like Future Jesus batman?????? I don't know, all I know is that this a recommended game, and I do enjoy its precense, don't get comfy, as soon as Persona 5 comes out your are going right back to HELL FF0HD. Mark MY WORDS. unless you impress me. But really this is a good game. Try it,or steal my Laptop.

reviewText:
Yes it's an action game running at 30FPS, but it plays well enough that it isn't too much of a problem. Controls are smooth and the developers have opted for the relatively simplistic option of deferring antialiasing to supersampling, and at maximum anti-aliasing the game powers through at a downsampled 4k - and doesn't miss a beat on my i7-4790k/OG Titan combo. Textures do look like they have been put through an upscaling filter but they've tried really hard by adding specular mapping and a host of special effects including switchable color correction, screen space shadows, and depth of field effects.

The game feels like a slightly clunkier Kingdom Hearts with a very light sprinkling of Not A Real Sheen Maygoomi Tensay Gaem 3/4 in there with regards to timed conversations, and just the lightest touch of Crisis Core for feels.

Reccomended at a discount price. I got this for £13.34 from GMG.

reviewText:
Final Fantasy Type 0, a game of the Fabula Novala Crystalisis is finally on the PC. While it fixed a lot of the graphical lag, the game is still almsot entirely a medicore mess. I would warn anyone to caution getting this unless you are not just a dire hard Fianl Fantasy fan but also a very engaged fan of the Crystalsis storyline. The game has nothing to do with the 13 storyline, but uses the same Mythos and Universe. That being said, if you know how FFXIII plays out then you're quite able to figure out how Type 0 must end. In addition to this, the game is overrun with poorly designed characters. The game has you cotrolling an entire team of 13 soilders, and the character development is all over the place it's real easy to loose who is doing what when were and why.

The story does have a few merits, though. Amazing cutscenes and story presentation make the game almost enticing for that and that alone. You feel truly invested in what happens & that your mission(s) actually save the world.

Sadly, this does not recover it fromt he plethora of problems noted above coupled with the pretty horrible voice acting/character idle movements. A saving grace would be the gameplay, except that it is also beyond saving. You can easily complete the game changing weapons/acessories twice, and rarely to never powering up magic/summons. This makes obtaining Armor/Weapons/Summons mostly pointless, unless you want to go into NG+. Suppose NG+ is the selling pont of the game, should it take you till level 40 to need to upgrade weapons? I think not.

In the end, if you love the mythos, play it, if you hated FFXIII's lore steer clear away from this hot mess of a game. If you've been dying to play this but don't own a PSP, then maybe this is for you. Just know you're getting into a game that can be 100%'d in less than twenty hours with no real effort.

reviewText:
White screen on start-up.... tried running in administrative mode and from admin CMD that were both tested in window mode or full screen selects. verified game installation to be working correctly, checked regional clocks for decimal setting being . instead of ' or , keys. Tried both resolution settings and have all drivers up to date. Tried numerous locale changes, I am running a 64 bit windows 7, and Direct X was reinstalled twice to confirm it was working correctly.

In short, I highly recommend you DO NOT purchase this game. No game should have this many issues with at least getting past the launch menu. O_O Please do consider taking my advice by RUNNING FAR AWAY from this game and sparing yourself the frustration that is this poorly done port for FFT0 Steam.

My last bit of advice is that for any of you having similar issues is to quickly request steam to issue a refund for your purchase. Especially... if you made this game a pre-order request like myself. I truly wanted to have high hopes for this game, it to me showed an inkling of the old Final Fantasy industry and demonstrated potential that SE was trying to find renewed inspirations from it's past achievements. But sadly, in typical SE fashion, they continue to prove just how poor their services are rendered and just how very transparent they are these days.

All that I have left that I feel needs to be expressed is shame on you SquareEnix, you do a grave disservice to your talented predecessors and visionaries of old from the late 90's. It truly is a shame we lost Monolith soft to Nintendo and are now left with an empty shell of what used to be two very good game companies, ones that used to somewhat demonstrate a much needed competency for both it's consumer base and it's service. I really think it is fair to say this will be my last game purchase from SE and I will exclusively support their new found interests in producing Anime titles henceforth because frankly speaking their anime titles are of much better quality than most of their recent games for the past decade and a half.

P.S. I may live in Japan, but I lost all desire on ever wanting a tour of the SquareEnix facility, I realized the artistic souls that were the companies Enix and Square are no more.

reviewText:
final fantasy type 0. the long awaited psp game that finally have shipped out of japan to other countries.

is this the game for you??? then answer these questions to yourself:

> are you a final fantasy fan?
> do you like jrpgs?
> can you be forgiving that there are some bugs that will take while to be fixed?
> do you have time to invest in a certain game?
> do you like tough challenges?

if all of the above are yes. then its the game for you
if there is even a single no. then you might reconsider it.

here are the things what i do and don't like about the game:

pros:
+ support characters can be helpful when you are in bind
+ great music
+ controlls are smooth (used the ps3 controller)
+ variety in characters and preferred playstyle
+ can be challenging
+ japanese audio
+ some side quests can keep you busy in a good way and prepare you for the next mission.

cons:

- to much grinding: leveling can be fun. but if its a chore its not.
- support characters wont reach when you have to take a flying ranged enemy and there is no way to reach them.
- expert trial are way to high and consumes to much time.
- training mode is to repetitive and unrewarding. there are better areas to grind.
- tasks are vague with the rewards you get and you have to take a risk to give items in return for less unwanting/usefull.
- some enemies are just plain unfair and give you the sense you can beat them in missions.
- english texts doesnt align the personallity with the japanese audio
- some technical difficulties.

beside the bugs and technical issues, the game is ok. i don't really like but maybe someone else or even you can like it. some of my cons can be your pros.

reviewText:
Don't waste your money on this. Seriously. This is one hell of a bad port. The graphics are even worse as seen on the screenshots. Now don't get me wrong, graphics are not everything, but this one looks flat out atrocious with muddy textures, no detail level and bad to none lip sync. It makes you wanna throw up, believe me.
What's more, the gameplay feels stiff and wooden, you're wondering, if your controller is broken (yes, even when using an xbox-controller). The dialog scenes are drawn out with little to no interesting revelations, no autosave feature and there's that ESC-key ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t again like in XIII and XIII-2.
You could definitely say I'm a FF-fanboy. I played 4,5,6,7,8,9,10,10-2... I also LOVE the Lightning-trilogy, which many people thought had serious flaws. I devoured those games. But Type-0 is really the first Final Fantasy game ever I've been truly disappointed about right from the very beginning.
At least I got a quick refund. Steam seems to be aware it sucks.

reviewText:
So, I'm a huge RPG fan and Final Fantasy VII was one of my earliest ones. I played the original Final Fantasy type-0 on the PSP and, you know what, I loved it.

The game stood apart from other Final Fantasy games significantly in story and scope without completely abandoning the style. The story was interesting and didn't baby you. The characters were varied and the writers understood that having many primary characters meant not being able to touch on many others outside of that cast. The gameplay was solid, though I do wish there were more strategy segments as that was so, so, so much fun. The parallels to WWII were attractive. This was my favorite Final Fantasy since Crisis Core and gave me resounding hope for Fabula Nova Chrystallis.

With that being said, don't buy this port. It's slow, clunky and lags far too much to be worth your money. Go borrow a PSP and get the original version then download an English patch for it. It should still be available on the Japanese PSN store. Despite the beautiful graphics and wonderful story, the game is nearly unplayable with the speed it runs with. This was acceptable on a smaller system, but not here.
voteText: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
When I found out about this game, I was definitely intrigued. A Final Fantasy game with action RPG combat, a large and diverse cast of characters and a much grittier story than the typical plot from the rest of the series.
Ultimately, I do not recommend the game. Here are my pros and cons:

Pros:
1. The combat system has some good depth to it.
2. The characters all feel very different, I took time to play as each one before quitting the game. All have different personalities in addition to different weapon types and playstyles.
3. Grinding, for those interested, is made easy with the repeated encounters mechanic. You no longer have to run around in circles to grind levels. You simply hit a button to fight again.

Cons:
1. Performance on PC is terrible. Sub 30fps regularly even when you're out of combat.
2. Input lag exists far beyond your typical 30fps experience. When the framerate is at its worst, a full second can pass between a button press and the execution of a basic attack. This results in occassionally frustrating combat.
3. Combat systems are nicely done, but very poorly explained for non-regulars.
4. Voice acting, even for a Final Fantasy game, is absolutely horrific. Every character sounds completely uninterested in the plot.
5. Sound in the cutscenes is completely out of sync. Sometimes sounds would happen almost a full second or two before the action happens on screen. Characters can have closed mouths and still be yelling due to the audio sync delay.
6. Texture work is actually WORSE on PC than it is on PS4. Every game I have ever played on my current system looks far better on my system than it did on PS4. When I saw my friends play this game on PS4 I was even more upset with this port.
7. The story is lackluster. I may have a blunted opinion of this because of how much the audio sync issue broke my since of immersion in the first cutscenes, but I am completely uninterested in the story other than the back story about the 4 kingdoms.


Summary: This game has a fun combat system and a great cast of characters muddled beneath a lackluster story, terrible visuals and horrible input lag. It also has TERRIBLE audio sync issues that completely ruined my experience with the opening cutscenes. Even with a controller (which is apparently preferred), I can't recommend this game to anyone. Even RPG fans or fellow Final Fantasy players like me.

date: otherwise the keyboard controls seemed decent enough. 3 Hours into it and considering it's a PSP game we could never play I don't have any complaints. It is what it is."

reviewText:
This game plays fine on my A-10 AMD APU and my biggest issues are the video and audio stutters.

Storyline looks awesome reminds me of Fushi Yuugi. Vermillion is Suzaku and such. The Chocobo in the beginning CGI is even named Chichiri. <3

The Fushigi remnants I see just make the game all the more sad. People and animals do die in this game. They don't come back either. There is blood and there are brutally gorey scenes. Be prepared for feels.

Graphics are kinda iffy at times, most things look fine, but in some areas you can tell the textures weren't upgraded to suit the HD Scale.

The camera acts a bit wonky, especially with the lock-on features. I will be trying different camera settings in the launcher to see if this can be stopped. the split second change in angles kind of make it tough to see what is going on.

Overall I like it and will need to power through the sad parts. Plays just like Black Rock Shooter on the PSP. (Another JRPG)

reviewText: I was so excited to see this game coming out in the US having played the PSP version of the game several times. My first impressions were ok but I was expecting much more that what was povided. For starters it almost feels as if the movie bits were all kept virtually the same. They might have been touched up but thats not the biggest issue. When it comes to in game graphics they look pretty solid and im running it on the best settings possible currently. But being an HD release of this game certain things bug me, the outer areas still look horribly pixilated and lots of NPCs sit or stand like statues. Would it have been so hard to make them look more human in their movements? Now im not asking for super amazing graphics its just if im gonna pay money for this remake at least go all out even if it cost a few more bucks im more than willing to dish out the cash for it. Gameplay is solid and i havent run into any bugs or glitches, overall the game is still great just expected more change. Rate `10/10 for gameplay 7.5/10 for visuals and the english voice acting is good for some characters, others not so much...I wish i could pick who was in english and who was in jap

reviewText: I downloaded hours (about 18?) for this game and i get to see a nice introduction into a story (even if it wasn't that much HD like they sadi). When I started to actually play it (with keyboard, mouse isn't even supported, you have to move the camera with NUMPAD!), it was just horrible to play, since the buttons that were shown didn't match the keys on the keyboard. You are thrown into a epic game you have no control over unless you got a controller, which I don't have. I don't want to say the game is bad since I played like 15 minutes and the only thing I was doing was spamming an attack button, trying to get the camera under control and trying to move at the same time, which is very hard to deal with. I'll wait for an Update that may fix this game, but I don't recommend to buy this game unless you got a controller (why do you have to buy a controller for pc? -.-) and the games other issues like non-HD graphics, 30fps lock and crashes are fixed.

reviewText: In my opinion, in the short amount of time that I have been able to play this game since its release yesterday, Type-0 is a game worth playing if you are in it for the story and overall gameplay. Yes, it lags at times, but it is to be expected, being a port of what was originally a PSP game. Anyway, on my computer, it lags MUCH LESS than the Final Fantasy XIII and XIII-2 ports, so that is most definitely a plus.\nDon't play it if you're one of those sticklers who are fussy about it playing smoothly, save yourself the time and play something else. Do play it if you care for the storyline and gameplay. I say it's worth putting up with the 30FPS for those two things alone.

reviewText: Now granted this may look like a quick review having only 30 minutes into the game at the moment, however I have also played this on consoles so I have a lot more experience than it may seem with this game. Idk why this game currently at the time of this review has a mixed reaction on the User Reviews with a 50% rating. I have not come across any sort of technical problems, such as glitches(graphical or otherwise). There are some odd things however. You can't exit the game easily when you want to. The main menu has no exit game choice, that I do admit is odd, so I had to use my window key to get out of it. Alt-Tab will probably work as well. However the rest of the game is fantastic. They brought back an overworld to the FF series which imo was sorely missed. Graphically when you look closely the graphics aren't that impressive, you can tell the game came from the PSP, however rather than focusing on the details and instead looked at as a whole when it comes to its graphics, it's actually a beautiful game with beautiful design. I loved the combat in Crisis Core FF7 on the PSP as well as Kingdom Hearts, if anyone has played those, you'll be somewhat prepared for the combat. Obviously buttons will have changed and it is instead a party system, but otherwise the combat is very nice and satisfying. I use controller for this game and when using a controller you can only navigate menus using the D-pad and not the stick. It's unfortunate and annoying but I assume it is because it was originally a PSP game. The story is give or take, it can be interesting at times, and not during other times, but it's up to you. I have no problems with it. Overall I'd give this addition to the FF series an 8/10. If you are not an FF fan you obviously won't enjoy it. If you are like me, an FF fan, I feel like you'll enjoy it but again it's up to you.

reviewText:
I played this on the PSP last year and enjoyed it very much.

Story  - Enjoyable for what it is. It's definitely a Final Fantasy type of story. However, some things aren't explained very well. No spoilers here. You can read that elsewhere.

Gameplay  - An action-rpg that reminds me a bit of Monster Hunter and God Eater. Lots of dodging and timing to get attacks in. Grinding levels and upgrading skills/magic is a thing here too. Each member of Class 0 is fun to play with in their own separate ways. Camera is crazy sometimes but not game breaking (IMO).

Graphics  - Runs smoothly on my PC at 30fps, at 19020x1080 resolution on standard settings. Since it is a remastered PSP game there are many things that still look less than HD, such as generic NPCs. However, overall things look nice as long as you are not counting pixels.

Conclusion  - If you enjoy Final Fantasy games and action-rpgs in general, graphics don't matter THAT much to you, you don't already hate this game, and are willing to play it for what it is, PLAY IT.

reviewText: Worst story in any final fantasy game. I'd honestly rather play Final Fantasy 13-3 and I ♥♥♥♥ing hate that game's story. This game is 110% archetypes and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ tropes. There isn't a single line of dialogue that was interesting or unexpected. How people find the story to be *okay* is beyond me. I was on board with it initially, and it starts off with a gritty and dark tone during the first few opening cutscenes but the actual story is 2/10. I was happier when I played the game untranslated on PSP, not knowing what any of the characters were saying. Every other time a cutscene happens and its a dialogue scene I have to debate whether I should close the game or not because it is so abhorrently bad and I am usually one to love FF cutscenes.\n\n

reviewText:
Another great addition to the Final Fantasy franchise. This little surprise first came out on phones and the PSP before getting ported to consoles and then here. The combat system feels really crisp and refreshing compared to other FF games. A decent story with predicatable but still interesting twists help make this one of my favorite Final Fantasy games of all time.

You do not want to play this game with a Mouse and Keyboard. It does not function well although it still works if you are really desperate. I can't tell the difference between 30 and 60 fps so I can't rly give much opinion on that 30 FPS lock that SE tends to do for their PC ports. Aside from that the game runs perfectly on a GTX 770 and I5-4690k with no crashes in both windowded and fullscreen mode. Visuals are slightly improved from the PS4 version if you have everything maxed.

I HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone looking for a top notch final fantasy game.

reviewText:
For Your Information: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD is a port of a PSP game of the same name (minus the HD part) that was only released in Japan.

It is also the first Final Fantasy game I've ever seen that has had true real-time combat, and not that terrible fusion ♥♥♥♥♥ in later FF games. Considering this, I was intrigued enough to buy this abortion.

Don't get this game; it is the worst PC port I have ever played.

The combat is really the only thing I can praise about it, as it's rather fun despite being very cluttered. I wouldn't say it saves it though.

reviewText:
Square Enix is slowly showing they care. But time will tell whether they truly do or not
*This review is solely about the quality of the port and NOT the game itself.*
The game has been patched numerous times. Though I do not own it anymore. I am unable to tell whether my biggest game breaking problem has been fixed.
Cons  Game seems to do some Texture Filtering. But there is no option for it. Forcing 16xAF through drivers provides better detail on hair''' http://screenshotcomparison.com/comparison/139090
There is constant tearing no matter WHAT I do, creating a profile and forcing Vsync doesn't seem to work.
If your monitor is less than 1080p, but greater than 720p. You will run into problems
On my 768p TV, it will not allow 1080p. Only 720p. On my 1600x900 monitor, 1080p works. On another user's 1600x900 monitor, 1080p doesn't work. http://www.neogaf.com/forum/showpost.php?p=175888043&postcount=1106 http://www.neogaf.com/forum/showpost.php?p=175888290&postcount=1107
Setting the game to windowed 1080p on one of the set-ups mentioned does not display a 1080p Window but still renders at 1080p.
EX Screenshots http://www.neogaf.com/forum/showpost.php?p=175886507&postcount=1102 Notice the GPU usage is at around 70+%. This is on a 980 with Highest AA turned on. Highest AA at 720p only uses around 35% GPU usage
On one of my Audio set ups, the Audio from FMVs comes out garbled like it's trying to time stretch it.
Clip https://www.copy.com/s/t%3AyxPydE9QwAKqYAQL%3Bp%3A%252FType-0%2520Garbled%2520audio.mp3
http://www.neogaf.com/forum/showpost.php?p=175886507&postcount=1102
The audio isn't garbled on my other sound setup AT ALL though! I have audio going from SPDIF out to another room that is run through a DAC to an amplifier. Though if the problem was on the output side I wouldn't be able to capture the audio problem from within windows right?. EX to record the audio clip above, I had to set my playback device back to the analog L/R out. But when I actually USE that output in my other room on my 1600x900 monitor, no audio problems. Dedicated sound card too WHAT:?

My monitor is 59.790Hz, other have mentioned the audio skipping if they don't run at 60hz or the game goes under 30hz in cutscenes (I have an i7 and a 980)
There is no way to remap keyboard keys or Gamepad controls. Only a few presets for each
They had the opportunity to further improve the rest of the uneven character model work but didn't. Their explanation was lack of time with the console versions. But Square Enix was the one who supplied them, not HexaDrive. So once again, SE is at fault.
Patched    Mouse Cursor is ALWAYS on screen, you can move it to the edge, but it doesn't disappear completely. - [PATCHED]
Game is locked to only 2 display/base render resolutions. 720p and 1080p. (But the game can render up to 4k without problem. WAT - [PATCHED but still doesn't support resolutions higher than 1080p]
Some players are reporting FMV audio de-syncs [PATCHED]
http://www.neogaf.com/forum/showpost.php?p=175864988&postcount=1034
High refresh rate monitors and GSync users are reporting sync problems. [PATCHED]
http://www.neogaf.com/forum/showpost.php?p=175861143&postcount=1028
Unless you set the controller to gamepad in the launcher, it will display Keyboard Icons [PATCHED]
______________________________________
Pros   The game performs without problems at a solid 30FPS, UNLIKE FFXIII and XIII-2
It has a lot of graphics options to choose from
It has decent Anti Aliasing! AA settings are as follows: Off (NoAA), Normal (Temporal AA), High (Temporal AA + 1.5x1.5 SSAA), Highest (Temporal AA + 2x2 SSAA)  http://hexadrive.jp/hexablog/
It looks amazing IMO despite all of the left over textures and models from the PSP Verison. Even the upscaled PSP FMVs dont' look so bad
FMV quality is VERY GOOD this time, to match the consoles. UNLIKE FFXIII and XIII-2
Offers separate Audio volume levels and Audio levels are generally pretty balanced.
Offers option to turn on Subtitles and has Dual Audio!______________________________________________
They sure as hell didn't care for any of their other past AAA Final Fantasy PC releases. I wish they would patch those. They NEED it so badly. And this game still needs more patches

reviewText:
I can sum up Final Fantasy Type-0 with one word: grindy. The story quickly out paces your level, forcing you to grind to catch up (thankfully there's an easy xp exploit to solve that problem). There are side-quests littered throughout the game but they boil down to simple fetch or kill quests. Even the main quests lack excitement as you simply work your way from point A to point B, killing everything in between. That is somewhat alleviated by the combat which I thoroughly enjoyed. The action RPG-style combat combined with 14 playable characters, each with their own different play style, was a blast.

+ Combat is really fun.
+ The eidolon's are neat, especially watching them in the cut scenes.
+ The story was decent enough.

- So very much grinding.
- Too many times where you get one-hit killed.
- I found the game generally lacking in excitement.

Playtime: ~ 27h
6/10

reviewText: It has good story (though somehow darker compared to the main FF series). I've played the PSP version though I wasn't able to finish it as I'm not very good in Japanese (just got past chapter 3). I don't have the minimum required graphics card memory size of 1 GB for this port, so I'm suffering sharp FPS drop when I leave the graphics settings to the default setup. But somehow it becomes playable when set to the low-spec setup. The keyboard settings are again non-customizable and can only be changed between two presets (Type A and Type B) and you may need to have some practice with the settings where you can be comfortable.\n\nThis game is recommended for FF fanatics but seriously this port (not the game itself) is worse than the more recent PC port of Final Fantasy. I'm expecting a more stunning visuals for this port considering it was ported first for PS4 though I'm not sure if this is because of my graphics card but I'm not quite impressed with this port.

reviewText:
Final Fantasy Type-0 HD, Wasn't expecting the most amazing port ever but what we got average to say the least. So far i haven't encountered any game breaking issues or massive bugs, 30 fps lock is to be expected from a psp re release considering the engine.

On the the gameplay, its fun and additive with tons of different options to really make your experince your own. The lock on system can be a pain at times while close to walls or in tight areas, other cons are with graphics looking muddy and washed out at times but the gameplay is where this title shines.

This game has its problems but that doesnt stop it from being an awesome game final conclusion if your a fan of the JRPG genre or enjoy the final fantasy series Final Fantasy Type-0 is deffinetly worth your time.
